title: Treasury Yields Slip After Inflation Data Matches Expectations
sub_head: Core price index climbed 4.9% in November from a year earlier
body:
U.S. government bond yields gave up overnight gains Friday after data showing the fastest inflation in decades reinforced investorsâ€™ expectations for the economy to start slowing next year while the Federal Reserve tightens monetary policy.
The yield on the benchmark 10-year U.S. Treasury note settled at 1.487%, according to Tradeweb, compared with 1.486% on Thursday.
